result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert N. Cormier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with C. Cormier.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert N. Cormier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:22 p.m. Defendant Robert N. Cormier in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached a resolution.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Statement by DE. Court orders: 60 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 2 days CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through,  defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C/C w/ C. Cormier, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Robert N. Cormier in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Carver requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 12:59 p.m. Defendant Robert N. Cormier in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting cash bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:05 pm.
